column5: For all you Deer hunters
I remember that pic from last year, someone said it was taken around Tbay?
No antlers and herding indicates to me that this is late winter, probably March depending how far up north this was taken.
When do the deer lose their antlers Bob ?? I had a buck in the back yard a few days back and my wife asked me when, but I have no idea
What I'd like to know is what the dude is spraying on his sled track. Probably WD-40 eh?  I hear it has apple cider in it.
Some will drop their antlers as early as mid to late december and otheres I have seen in april still with them on. Im not positive but I think its the hormone levels that trigger it.
Thanks Rich, I was never sure about that.
Lew,  Usually not long after I squeeze the trigger....  richb has the non-smartass answer....it can vary.
MUST be, because if it was as rumoured fish oil, there would salmon swimming up that hill....
That looks like the North Humberland forest. I trail ride up that hill quite often in the summer on my dual sport..
